intro: Salsola indica, commonly known as Russian thistle or goatweed, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a layer of fine, white hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it is well adapted to arid and saline environments. Salsola indica has a robust root system that allows it to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in agricultural fields and along roadsides. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through seeds make it an invasive species in many regions.
